text: Hi, can somebody please explain the differences between the scheduling mechanism of Threads.@spawn  and Threads.@threads for loops. When I used @spawn at each iteration of the loop the CPU cores were loaded 50% or sometimes less. After I switched to use  Threads.@threads  everything got normal. CPU usage 100%.

elements.text: Hi, can somebody please explain the differences between the scheduling mechanism of Threads.@spawn  and Threads.@threads for loops. When I used @spawn at each iteration of the loop the CPU cores were loaded 50% or sometimes less. After I switched to use  Threads.@threads  everything got normal. CPU usage 100%.

text: One is static, the other is dynamic. If you have long running computations that have uneven runtimes, use `@spawn`. If you have many short functions with similar runtimes use `@threads`
